Just the absolute basics for now, more interesting results are coming.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041239428/job/21960258587)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041239428/job/21960258641)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8041239428/job/21960258535)

This syntax with parentheses is rarely used in mathlib4; it appears mostly only when the structure has several fields of the same type:
```suggestion
  I : Type v
```
(And similarly below.)
Thanks, I don't know why I keep repeating this mistake.
Could we consider making this a typeclass?
Do you have a concrete case in mind where this would be beneficial? I don't really see how typeclass resolution would help beyond the completely trivial case `IsIndObject (yoneda.obj X)`.
I was thinking of stability conditions (by finite products?), but anyway, it would be better to state any such condition in terms of the category of ind-objects...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the definition of an ind-object

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): the recognition theorem for ind-objects
